alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:26PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok River near Dalton Highway from Mileposts 401 to 407. * WHEN...Until 200 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flood waters are eroding the Dalton Highway between Milepost 401 and 407, with the road down to one lane. If conditions worsen, the road may wash out and become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM AKDT, the Sagavanirktok River continues to flow out of its bank due to remnant ice in the main channel. This is forcing the water over its bank to the west and causing erosion along the Dalton Highway near milepost 403. These conditions are expected to persist until ice in the main channel clears. Elevated flows are expected to continue, especially with rainfall expected late this week. - Rain and snowmelt in the Brooks Range will cause the Sagavanirktok River to continue to slowly rise through the weekend. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Travelers are urged to call 511 or visit 511.alaska.gov for the latest on road conditions in the area.
